basics.name: Young-Mok Jung
basics.label: AI Researcher
basics.summary: I am an AI research scientist at Genome Insight, where I collaborate with geneticists to develop secondary and tertiary analysis solutions for genomics data, aiming to uncover novel biological insights to enhance human health

work.name: Inocras .Inc (formally Genome Insight .Inc)
work.summary: Transforming genome analysis into data-driven and scalable way.

education.institution: Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)
Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)

awards.title: Samsung Humantech Paper Award
awards.summary: Awarded Silver-prize (118 out of 1972 papers) for the paper titled 'Co-optimizing for Flow Completion Time in Radio Access Network' at the 2023 Samsung Humantech Paper Award.

awards.title: Samsung PhD Sponsorship
awards.summary: Awarded full scholarship for Ph.D. program at KAIST by Samsung Electronics.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

references.name: Professor Dongsu Han
references.reference: Ph.D. advisor at KAIST. He is a professor in the School of Electrical Engineering at KAIST.

references.name: Professor Young Seok Ju
references.reference: Ph.D. co-advisor at KAIST. He is a professor in the graduate school of medical science and technology at KAIST.
